channel.title: Afterlife?
channel.description: what do you think will happen to you after you die, do you belive in heaven and hell or do you think nuthing at all will happen and you still relise that your doing nuthing but when u relise it what will you think about?

item.title: Afterlife?
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

II think that when you’re dead, you’re dead. It’s as simple as that. When your body “dies,” your brain still fuctions for about 15 minutes. Once your brain realizes that your body is dead, it dies. Then you officially cease to exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife?
item.dc:creator: @zbizzle1337 zbizzle1337
item.description:
@zbizzle1337 wrote:

[quote=“Speakerboxxx, post:6, topic:10238”]Mhm…I think it all depends on how you lived this life.
If you lived a good life helping other people and such, you’ll get rewarded in the next life.
This determines a person being ugly or pretty, fat or healthy.[/quote]
Uhh what about bimboes? They’re hot but usually very bitchy.

Well I have no idea what would happen, but it seems so unlikely that all the memories and knowledge you obtain in your life can all just disappear. SOMETHING’S gotta happen to your memories no?

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I’ll figure it out when I get there.

Until then, I’m alive.

Edit:
However if you are interested in my beliefs, I don’t think anyone has any level of personal existence after death. Basically, the universe as a whole is one “point” of existence, as are the infinite number of other universes. So in reality, a universe is like a scenario, a set of cause and affect, so for example in another universe I may have misspelled “scenario” (that’s merely an example). So the universe is made of an unimaginable amount of atoms, and each atom is a “life” and has some level of intellect, even if not much. Each living creature, even single celled organisms, are made up of atoms that work as a collective, and think with one “mind” or one “soul”. Now when we die, our atoms will lose their ability to act in a collective, and therefore our conscious mind (and subconscious (or any form of) mind for that matter) dissipates. So after death a minuscule part of the universe loses its ability to act as a collective, however no one actually died. It’s similar in fashion if one, single cell on your body dies.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife?
item.dc:creator: @ace_pilot737 ace pilot737
item.description:
@ace_pilot737 wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:7, topic:10238”]I believe in some way you are reborn. That you have had other lives before.

I was watching a show the other day and it was a talk show with an well known professional psychic on it. A mothers son was having extremely violent night terrors, no sleep doctor could at all explain it. She said that in his other lives he was buried alive, eaten at by bugs (The child normally gets off the floor in these terrors and screams at the floor, terrified)

Whether real or not, It’s what i believe.[/quote]
yea that would seem logical… that your like reincarnated to an animal or another human… there’s lots of post about religion or stuff relating with religion now =S

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife?
item.dc:creator: @LegendScape LegendScape
item.description:
@LegendScape wrote:

Again as an X monk my teachings were that of heaven and hell, all that and such As in my thoughts i came to find that a perfect existance void of any evil, pain, sorrow, or fear would void itself of any interest. Living perfection and worry free means what is there left sure we have the enlightenment but beyond that into eternal existance one must ask himself how can you live without actions without being unsure of the next part of your life. Dull being my directive point. I do not stray from the belief in my teachings although I cannot help but questions the outcome of enternal life of no difference. Is anyone following?

Read full topic

She said that in his other lives he was buried alive, eaten at by bugs (The child normally gets off the floor in these terrors and screams at the floor, terrified)
